intro: Oxytropis tudanensis, commonly known as Tutan's oxytropis, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to Central Asia and is typically found in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, compound leaves. It produces yellow or pale purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Oxytropis tudanensis is adapted to harsh environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
